1→# Abe Diaz - Complete Profile
     2→
     3→> Last updated: December 2025
     4→
     5→---
     6→
     7→## Identity
     8→
     9→| Field | Value |
    10→|-------|-------|
    11→| **Name** | Abe Diaz |
    12→| **Title** | Sr. Manager - Disaster Relief at Amazon |
    13→| **Location** | Greater Seattle Area |
    14→| **Tagline** | Seattle / Tech / Evangelist |
    15→| **Languages** | English (Native), Spanish (Native) |
    16→
    17→---
    18→
    19→## Professional Summary
    20→
    21→A passionate technologist and humanitarian leader with 15+ years of experience spanning enterprise software, mobile platforms, and logistics innovation. Career highlights include building mobile apps at **Deloitte** and **NBCUniversal**, optimizing revenue systems at **Amazon Prime Video**, and now leading Amazon's global disaster relief operations.
    22→
    23→**The Pivot (2017):** Born and raised in Puerto Rico, Abe was compelled to act when Hurricane Maria devastated his homeland. He volunteered to lead Amazon's first relief plane to the island—an experience he describes as "life-changing." This led to his permanent transition to the Disaster Relief team.
    24→
    25→**Mission:** Leveraging Amazon's logistics and technology for humanitarian good.
    26→
    27→---
    28→
    29→## Impact & Achievements
    30→
    31→- **200+** disaster relief efforts worldwide
    32→- **26+ million** relief items delivered
    33→- **"Seattle's 40 Under 40"** (Puget Sound Business Journal, 2023)
    34→- Pioneered "Proactive Supply Pre-positioning" strategy
    35→- Expanded scope to include **AWS Disaster Response**
    36→- Partners: Red Cross, World Central Kitchen (WCK), World Food Programme (WFP)
    37→
    38→---
    39→
    40→## Work Experience
    41→
    42→### Amazon (2016 - Present) — 9+ years
    43→
    44→| Role | Period | Focus |
    45→|------|--------|-------|
    46→| **Sr. Manager - Disaster Relief** | Feb 2025 - Present | Leading global disaster relief strategy, logistics, and technical resources |
    47→| **Principal Technical Product Manager** | Oct 2021 - Feb 2025 | Developed proactive strategies; established regional Disaster Relief Hubs |
    48→| **Sr. Technical Program Manager** | Apr 2019 - Oct 2021 | Global relief operations; Prime Video payments & revenue automation |
    49→
    50→### NBCUniversal Media, LLC (2014 - 2016)
    51→**Mobile Apps & Devices Program Manager**
    52→- Managed non-web platforms: iOS, tvOS, FireTV, Roku
    53→
    54→### Microsoft (2013 - 2014)
    55→**CS - Program Manager Tech**
    56→- OEM/Mobile Operator relationships for Windows Phone Update Team
    57→
    58→### AT&T Mobility (2013)
    59→**Developer Evangelist/Advocate**
    60→- Voice of the developer for AT&T Developer Program
    61→
    62→### Deloitte (2009 - 2013)
    63→- **Business Solution Analyst & Technical Evangelist** (2011-2013): Mobile Center of Excellence, C-Suite applications
    64→- **Software Engineer** (2009-2011): Enterprise .NET web applications
    65→
    66→---
    67→
    68→## Education
    69→
    70→| Degree | Institution | Year |
    71→|--------|-------------|------|
    72→| **MS, Information Security** | Lipscomb University | 2012 |
    73→| **BS, Computer Engineering (Software)** | University of Puerto Rico at Mayaguez | 2009 |
    74→
    75→**Activities:** IEEE, SHPE, ACM, ISACA
    76→
    77→---
    78→
    79→## Skills
    80→
    81→| Category | Skills |
    82→|----------|--------|
    83→| **Core** | Disaster Relief, Philanthropy, Product Management, Technical Program Management |
    84→| **Technical** | Mobile (iOS, Android, FireTV), Cloud/Logistics (Amazon), .NET |
    85→| **Soft Skills** | Public Speaking, Developer Evangelism, Team Leadership, Process Automation |
    86→
    87→---
    88→
    89→## Open Source (GitHub: abe238)
    90→
    91→| Repository | Description |
    92→|------------|-------------|
    93→| [project-kickoff](https://github.com/abe238/project-kickoff) | CLI to scaffold production-ready projects with security best practices |
    94→| [aipm-resume-analyzer](https://github.com/abe238/aipm-resume-analyzer) | Resume analysis against AI PM frameworks (GPT, Claude, Gemini) |
    95→| [yt-slides](https://github.com/abe238/yt-slides) | Universal video screenshot extractor |
    96→| [grandapi](https://github.com/abe238/grandapi) | Raspberry Pi photo frame powered by Google Drive |
    97→
    98→---
    99→
   100→## Volunteering
   101→
   102→| Organization | Role | Period |
   103→|--------------|------|--------|
   104→| **Startup Weekend** | Event Organizer | 2015 - Present |
   105→| **ALPFA, Inc (Seattle)** | VP of Technology | 2015 - 2017 |

   107→
   108→---
   109→

   116→| **Puget Sound Business Journal** | "40 Under 40" Feature | Apr 2023 |
   117→

   123→
   124→**Philosophy:** "A passionate technologist. I attend as many conferences as I can, travel as much as I can with my amazing wife and try to eat some amazing food; all while meeting passionate and interesting people around the world."
   125→

   127→- 61 days in the air

entries.content:
I've created the implementation plan for the content strategy documentation. Here's a summary:

## Implementation Plan Created ✅

**Spec:** Create content strategy documentation linking docs/ to website sections

### Phases & Subtasks (9 total):

| Phase | Name | Subtasks |
|-------|------|----------|
| **Phase 1** | Research & Analysis | 3 subtasks |
| **Phase 2** | Content Strategy Documentation | 4 subtasks |
| **Phase 3** | Validation & Cleanup | 2 subtasks |

### Key Findings from Initial Analysis:

1. **Current docs/ structure:** Only contains `abe-diaz-profile.md` (comprehensive 11-section profile document)

2. **Content gap identified:** The spec mentions historical versions (website-content.md, website-content-ai-leadership.md, etc.) but these no longer exist - they appear to have been consolidated

3. **Website vs Docs:** The `index.html` uses only a small subset of the content available in `abe-diaz-profile.md`:
   - ✅ **Used:** Bio paragraph, profile image, likes, flight stats, social links
   - ❌ **Unused:** Detailed work history, education, skills, awards, open source projects, press coverage

### Deliverable:
The plan will produce `docs/CONTENT-STRATEGY.md` that:
- Documents the source of truth for content
- Maps website sections to their docs/ sources
- Identifies content available but not used
- Provides content update workflow guidelines

### Files Created:
- `.auto-claude/specs/013-create-content-strategy-documentation-linking-docs/implementation_plan.json`
- `.auto-claude/specs/013-create-content-strategy-documentation-linking-docs/build-progress.txt`
I'll help you implement subtask 1.1 - documenting all sections in abe-diaz-profile.md. Let me start by reading the relevant files to understand the context and current state.

entries.content: Now let me read the build-progress.txt to understand the current state and see what format I should use for documenting the sections:

entries.detail:
1→# Build Progress: Content Strategy Documentation
     2→
     3→## 2026-01-01 - Planning Phase
     4→
     5→### Initial Analysis Complete
     6→- Reviewed spec.md requirements
     7→- Explored project structure
     8→
     9→### Key Findings:
    10→1. **docs/ folder** contains only `abe-diaz-profile.md` (comprehensive profile document)
    11→2. **index.html** is the live website with different content subset
    12→3. The spec mentions historical content versions (website-content.md, website-content-ai-leadership*.md) but these no longer exist in the codebase - they may have been consolidated into abe-diaz-profile.md
    13→
    14→### Current Content State:
